image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

image.altText: Black and white image of cars hanging over Hobart's Tasman Bridge in 1975 after a section was knocked down by a ship

props.synopsis: An exhibition commemorating the collapse of the Tasman Bridge 50 years ago features two cars captured in a now-iconic photo of the incident. The museum now admits one of the Holdens on display "is not the car that was on bridge".

image.altText: jagged mountain range in the background heath and grasses in the foreground

props.synopsis: Tasmanian search and rescue helicopter crews were dispatched to three separate incidents at the weekend. Authorities are urging the public to better prepare for the state's unpredictable and challenging wilderness following a string of rescues over summer.

title.children: Hawaii New Year's fireworks toll rises to four with death of toddler

image.altText: Police cars on the beach at Point Connor where two men died

props.synopsis: Two men died after their boat capsized when a rope became entangled as they were retrieving craypots. Police say the deaths are being considered "an accidental drowning".

title.children: Men who drowned near Beachport were pulling in craypots, SA Police say

image.altText: An endangered Little Tern sitting next to its chick.

props.synopsis: More than 30,000 cubic metres of dredged sand deposited on a tiny island south of Newcastle in NSW has delighted an endangered little tern population. More than 50 have begun to lay and hatch their eggs in sand on the island.

title.children: Dredging creates 'perfect' island hatchery for endangered birds

image.altText: The AI Lucas, a tall, grey-haired blue-eyed man standing inside a kitchen.

props.synopsis: As the popularity of AI-generated companions grows, there are calls for greater regulation of a rapidly expanding world that some fear is disconnecting users from real-life human relationships.

title.children: AI partners are on the rise, raising complex questions for our society

image.altText: A young girl lies in a hospital bed. The skin on her face is red and inflamed and her arm is covered in plastic.

props.synopsis: Daniella Jacobs-Herd faces a decade of skin grafts after suffering severe burns from a Temu jumper purchased online, which failed to comply with Australian safety standards.Â

title.children: Girl suffers severe burns after Temu jumper ignites 'in a split second'

image.altText: Several police cars parked on a curved street, with officers standing outside, and trees in the background.

props.synopsis: South Australia's police chief says he has seen bodycam footage of an incident in which officers fatally shot an armed man at a home in Adelaide's south, saying those at the scene appeared to have taken the "necessary" steps to act in self-defence.

title.children: Police who fatally shot armed man took 'necessary' steps, commissioner says
